intro: Hesperogreigia landbeckii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its low, sprawling growth habit. The plant features yellow composite flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy seed heads that aid in wind dispersal. Its leaves are typically gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Hesperogreigia landbeckii is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability.
